Author: bogybogy#3962
Content: Hy to everyone,I got a question,I see many people are mad for this defi projects,....to me looks only like banks but only they are hiding under name of decentralised and Blockchain,...any suggestions

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with pegs CC, each person controls their portion of the money supply. each person independently decides how much, if any, pegged coins to issue or redeem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, interest is not charged for the issuing of coins. the coins are created and then freely usable

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the KMD that is collateral is locked until the account is closed

Author: LocoMB#8593
Content:
here is a Q/ comment regarding browser implemention:
are you guys aware of KaiOS?
personally, I think that Android and IOS are steaming piles of bullshit üêÑ  üêÑ  üêÑ üí© üêÑ 
and I take pride in stating that I have never owned such a spydevice, but: this antipathy is not to scorn mobile connectivity in general.
So: travelling with a mobile access point and some linux mobile device is method of choice, but this can be a bit cumbersome at times.
I will certainly take a close look at KaiOS, since not only is it for feature fones, but it also offers tethering for linux devices and has also a full Browser sitting in it- speaking of which: Will the upcoming KMD/DEX wallet be available for the HTML5 Browser in KaiOS?
Would seem a good idea to me..
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/KaiOS
https://www.kaiostech.com

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content:
"MANDATORY UPDATE v0.6.0 -- REQUIRED FOR MAINNET PAST BLOCK 800200 -- MAKE SURE TO UPGRADE BEFORE DECEMBER 15TH

Announcing Verus Version 0.6.0 Mainnet Release with the new VerusHash 2.1 and December 15th activation of VerusIDs, the only decentralized, friendly, self-sovereign, quantum ready, revocable, recoverable, blockchain identities in the world!

Thanks to everyone across the community for all of your help, testing, and feedback to make this the most exciting release in the history of the Verus Project! Once VerusIDs activate on December 15th, Verus will earn its place in blockchain history as the first to deliver a truly decentralized, easy to use, revocable, recoverable multisig capable identity protocol.

Make sure to backup your wallet.dat, as is always recommended on upgrade. Download and install the latest releases here: https://veruscoin.io/wallet.html

This version also include the Komodo network upgrade, which activates on the Komodo network on December 20th."

Author: Markus#5464
Content: whats so special with the nokia that make it attractive?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: from a developer's point of view it's the cheapest hardware for smart mobile apps.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the wikipedia page says that aprox 71% users in India are using Android, and from the rest KaiOS based phone's users are above iOS based phones!

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: so, if KaiOS takes place for the most basic mobile OS for the cheapest phones affordables by the rest of the world who can not afford expensive smart phones, it's good to have support for such OS.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: KaiOS as I read supports HTML based Apps on it.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: having just 512 MB RAM on it, with only 4GB of storage and expandable 32GB microSD and only 1.1 Ghz CPU, if our KMD tech can work on it, we should consider our tech the MOST reachable in the world.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: and as I understand nSPV is already supportable for such low end mobile hardware.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: and I guess AtomicDEX's core mm2 must be supportable.... at least I can hope since we have seen it being possible to run purely over web, using WASM.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @SHossain would be amazing to see any of my mentioned things getting tested on Nokia üòâ

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: @grewalsatinder yes, i can test. just need instructions
